message: For some bash commands it makes no sense running them in a Docker container like `ssh`, `vim`, `shutdown`, `service`, `ps`, `free`, `top`, `kill`, `mount`, `ifconfig`
Do not use sudo as it leads to unpredictable behavior. Use a tool like gosu to enforce root

Set the SHELL option -o pipefail before RUN with a pipe in it. If you are using /bin/sh in an alpine image or if your shell is symlinked to busybox then consider explicitly setting your SHELL to /bin/ash, or disable this check
Pin versions in npm. Instead of `npm install <package>` use `npm install <package>@<version>`
In POSIX sh, brace expansion is undefined.
Pin versions in pip. Instead of `pip install <package>` use `pip install <package>==<version>` or `pip install --requirement <requirements file>`
Do not use apt as it is meant to be a end-user tool, use apt-get or apt-cache instead
Avoid use of cache directory with pip. Use `pip install --no-cache-dir <package>`
